fields.summary: Android: Programatic Access to Preference Titles and Summaries

comments.body: Why does this need to be programatic? Is it not definable in the preferences.xml? Please attach a full example of the titanium code to be run as a test. Also a screen shot of what currently happens and the graphic marked up to show the changes.

Attached is "settings.png" to demonstrate why this needs to be programmatic. The screenshot arrow labeled "A" demonstrates all that we can do with Titanium right now. You can only put in static text, at compile time, and that will be displayed to the user.

Now look at the screenshot arrow labeled "B". These settings aren't editable, but they represent information outside of the Settings app that can change. Picture this as information about the database, cache size, version, latency, etc.

The "Possible Usage" in the original description (above) should be all that is necessary; is there something more I can include?
